title: Nicholas Tse denies neglecting his sons
text:
24 Oct– Nicholas Tse's camp has recently released a statement denying reports that the actor has been neglectful towards his two sons, Lucas and Quintus.

As reported on Mingpao, the statement came following a piece of online rumour on mainland forums that Lucas Tse - the actor's eldest son with Cecilia Cheung - told the Hong Kong media that he and his brother Quintus rarely see their father due to his busy schedule, and that he is glad Cecilia is separated from Nicholas as the actor is "not worthy" of their mother.

It is noted that this particular piece of interview was not verified and the relevant reports are unknown.

In a statement issued this week, EEG defended Nicholas, saying that there is no truth to the reports, and that the actor has a good relationship with his children.

"These misleading reports are harmful, insulting, and inflammatory, and it is affecting the children, causing serious problems. Our artiste will take any action necessary to protect his children and avoid unnecessary impact on them. He will not tolerate anybody or any platform using his children to create false news," the statement read.

EEG also urged the public not to be misled by these harmful rumours, and to recognise facts from fiction.

"Our company and artiste strongly condemns this misconduct and urge the relevant parties to stop, otherwise we will use legal means to pursue the matter," it added.

description: The actor's camp releases a statement denying rumoured interview with son Lucas
